Set #40055 Halloween Pumpkin: A nice seasonal polybag from 2013 that is in large abundance in Canada thanks to Bricktober this year. (2014) Is it a worthy addition to your seasonal display? Read on and find out.

column2: Halloween Pumpkin build is solid, sturdy and hollow. Inclusion of a light up brick feature would have been nice, you’ll have to MOC your own though as LEGO has not included this feature.
Looks great next to other seasonal builds and makes for a nice centerpiece as a giant spooky pumpkin in the middle of your Monster Fighters collection.
Limited display time and options if you don’t want it on the shelf year round.
Price per piece ratio slightly higher than standard polybags.

column1: I am really glad this was offered again as a Bricktober giveaway, I missed out on it and the free Witch Head from last year and I really think this is a much better build and iconic seasonal set compared to the witch head. Being able to MOC it into a light up jack-o-lantern would have been nice straight out of the package, however I understand why LEGO hasn’t integrated that function into something meant to be a simple build and cheap enough for an impulse buy. 10$ however is a high price to ask for this, even if there are slightly more pieces in it compared to standard polybags.

I recommend this one though, and judging by the TRU in my area it isn’t too hard to come by even now. Odd choice for stocking stuffer, but honestly this is a really clever and fun build. Definitely a great offering from LEGO seasonal polybags.
